A bakery and market are right across the street, pharmacy on the corner, post office three blocks away. The area is residential/small business, so we were not surrounded by other tourists. We wouldn't stay anywhere else in Paris and hope to visit with our friends at Regent's Garden again soon!

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel with impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: LMN8993
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Regents Garden in Paris for the first 4 days of our honeymoon. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a lovely suite. We had arrived early due to the overnight flight and were completely exhausted. Incredibly, they had our room ready for us at 10am. Our entire stay was lovely. A full buffet breakfast was offered in the dining room, but generally eaten outside in the beautiful courtyard behind the hotel. The concierge was excellent, kindly helping and encouraging me with my fumbling French, though always ready with the English words when my French failed me. Our room was beautiful--a bedroom with a comfortable king-size bed with an adjoining sitting room. The bathroom was also quite nice and included a large, soaking tub and a glassed-in shower. Overall, a wonderful stay in a charming hotel. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need”
Reviews.Author: giva21
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, located very near the city centre (Arc de triomphe). The rooms are not exactly spacious, but were big enough for our needs. They were clean with modern furniture. I really liked the bathrooms and the fact, that the beds had duvets instead of sheets and blankets (I really hate those since the blankets are usually very unclean). The staff were nice with positive attitude. We also got complimentary drinks in our minibar. I think we could not have stayed in a better hotel regarding the price and what we got for it, so I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Pauline_1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here at the end of July for 4 nights, we were celebrating our 1st wedding anniversary. The hotel is located near the Arc de Triomphe and is within walking distance to most sights - we walked everywhere. Our room was gorgeous - bold decoration and a modern bathroom, it was also quiet big for Paris. The bed was very comfy and the shower was great. Our room overlooked the courtyard, we had massive windows which opened right back allowing us to enjoy the sun shine in our room. It was really nice in the morning to sit by the open windows and have breakfast. The courtyard is a great asset to the hotel, its not often you find a hotel in central Paris with such a lovely garden to relax in. The staff were great and very helpful with directions and contacting attractions on our behalf to check opening times etc. My husband had arranged for champagne and chocolates to be waiting for us on arrival. The hotel staff went and got me Jeff de Bruges chocolates - they were delicious and a bottle of Laurent Perrier champagne - Yum! They also gave us a card congratulating us on our 1st anniversary - it was a lovely welcome! There is a supermarket across the street from the hotel and a great bakery. We had delicious fresh croissants for breakfast every morning. The is a bar next door to the hotel, which was always busy with locals, it had a nice atmosphere - it also serves food although we didnt eat here. This hotel is fabulous and when we return to Paris this is without a doubt were we will stay. Its unbeatable!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location and great hotel staff!”
Reviews.Author: DChouhan
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a quiet location and yet is still within 10 minutes walking distance from Tearne Metro station and 15 minute walk from Champs Elysees. Many eateries to choose from and a useful supermarket close by. We had a spacious Superior room with amazing decor, great shower/bathroom and mini fridge with complimentary drinks provided (topped up daily!). Hotel staff were fantastic especially Emmanuelle, spoke English and were all extremely welcoming. Luggage service provided was very useful with our timings of the Eurostar. This is a great hotel and would definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Staff”
Reviews.Author: hjbj
Reviews.Content: Picture this...rolling in to Paris at 5pm on Friday, stressed out, with the rental car on fumes and overdue to be dropped off, but where? Found the hotel with the GPS and the lady managing the desk knew immediately something was going on. We explained we situation and she called the rental company, got an extension and gave us directions to the closest place as the GPS might not explain all the recent detours because of the Tour d France taking place & construction going on. Got there in the nick of time and saved another days rental charges and upon returning to the hotel our bags were in the room and our large bike boxes safely stored in a locked closet. Nice first impression!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KayakChick72
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a traditional Parisian hotel, this is it! Very old but well-kept. Decor is nice, not quite my taste but they did lots of upgrades to make it comfortable. Room is small and bathroom is smaller. The room is big enough for a queen-size bed, the flat screen TV, and an closet/armoire. The closet fit all of our clothes. The first day we arrived, we were tired from jet-lag so we opened the windows (w/o screens of course) and took a nap. The breeze felt awesome! Not much room to walk around in the room. The shower that was greatness too, a walk-in shower, my husband loved it. But for the ladies, not much counterspace. Really cant fit two people but upgraded nice. One of the best things about the hotel was the free WiFi! We each have an iPhone and we could get email/internet easily. It is quite a walk to the train but we enjoyed it because of the good weather and we love to look at all of the buildings. It is in a great part of Paris. No worries about crime or feeling uncomfortable but that is most of Paris anyway! Could not really find too many good restaurants nearby. The bakery across the street was good but it was closed on the morning that we left, not sure why. And we left on a Tuesday. Maybe they were gone for their summer holiday. Didnt like the hotel breakfast very well plus that was expensive. However, they did supply you with a free minibar, how awesome is that! Staff was also helpful and very nice. We stayed here for four nights and would definitely consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, lovely hotel, quiet and respectable area”
Reviews.Author: queenmalice
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel with their highly trained, smiling, helpful staff; receptionists rose from their chair to greet us each time we passed them (who does that nowadays), and waiting staff couldn't have been more caring. For us, front of house staff can make or break a holiday - this helped make ours. If the staff could help, they did and nothing was too much bother for them. The hotel has a wonderful wee garden in which to dine and even a wood pigeon was finding the hotel so good that she was building a nest in one of their trees. Decor is snazzy! Room 305 was spotless, spacious and our lovely comfortable bed had a duvet. We also had a in-room free safe, free soft drinks, white bathrobes etc, sewing kit etc, free daily newspaper. We had an express breakfast one day which was fine because we were in a hurry. The day we left we had a full buffet breakfast which had everything we wanted, cold meats, cheeses, eggs, sausage, yoghurts, fresh and dried fruit, nuts, jams, honey, cereals, croissants, brioches, selection of breads, juices... everything! We liked the area because it was near the Arc de Triomphe and has a few little nice shops and restaurants nearby, but we liked the hotel and its staff even more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent standard of service and accommodation”
Reviews.Author: AdoScotland
Reviews.Content: The standard of the classic room was excellent: well-decorated, spatious, exceptionally clean and with extras such as complimentary soft drinks, hairdryer, bath robe and toiletries. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is fairly expensive but high quality. The internet price for accommodation is reasonable for the standard of room and location of hotel. It is only five minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe. I would recommend this hotel equally for business or pleasure and plan to use it again in future.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: WeL0veT0Travel7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this exquisite hotel for 7 nights and would recommend it without hesitation. The staff was courteous, knowledgeable and quite helpful. This a boutique hotel located close to the main sights, but in a neighborhood setting with a pastry shop and market right across the street. The hotel was renovated recently so everything is pristine, and sparkling clean. The color palette is in rich deep tones and the materials used are exceptional. Our room was a little small, but overlooked the garden, which was lovely. Also, the elevator was only big enough for 2-3 people, but we walked up the stairs to our first floor room Our favorite restaurant was Maison de Campagne at 18 bis, rue Pierre Demours - just around the corner. We took the Metro everywhere (just 4 blocks away). Our stay here was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Quite Hotel close the Local Rail Station”
Reviews.Author: SRIRAM_05
Reviews.Content: WE had a very pleasant stay at the hotel with the front desk personnel being quite friendly and helping us out with the Maps et al. Very friendly people. Both me and my wife eally had a good time with the staff. The location too was pretty good being very close to the Arc-de-Triumph and the local station. It is just a 5-10 min walk to both these locations. Also proximity to a convenient Store was an added advantage. The service too was quite decent. The biggest bonus was free Internet Usage at the business center located just adjacent to the front-desk. The only discomforture was the size of the elevator in which not more than 3-4 normal sized adults could fit in comfortable. We used the stairs most of the time and they too were quite narrow and serpentine in nature. One Cavet For new comers/first time tourists to the city, the location of this hotel might be a bit confusing as it is not visitble from the local station. One has to enquire about this hotel at nearby shops or diners to get there. As this was our only 2nd visit to Paris and coming straight from India we did find it difficult to initially locate the hotel after alighting from the station. But once we reached there, we could easily navigate ourselves well with the use of maps.

Reviews.Title: “Paris location of this property is not ideal, but it has a great garden!”
Reviews.Author: kokosandiego
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and although we were not disappointed, I would not stay here again. It is definitely out of the way, in the 17th...and the subway is a walk of about 5-6 blocks in either direction, which at night is not great. Personnel are great! Very, very helpful and accommodating to a degree. The rooms are very small, great beds, color scheme/design was not my taste but did look recently redone and baths were modern, although very small, ours was anyway. We did have a garden room which I would say is a must, but garden can only be used in nice weather and you are not allowed to take your own food/drink there which was a disappointment. There are no comfortable sitting areas, lobby is uncomfortable and only for looks..never saw anyone sitting there...bar should be made into a lovely sitting room with couches and lamps..never saw anyone in the bar. Breakfast is too expensive...18 euro pp...we never ate there...and breakfast room was not particularly inviting. Carpets in hallways need to be redone...the district is mainly businesses..not great walking, although we ate in a terrific restaurant not too far away, "Hier et Aujourd'hui"..was great food and cute place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, just simply Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: SFtraveler022
Reviews.Content: We would recomend this beautiful hotel without any doubts in our mind. We stayed in 2 different rooms during our 5 nights stay in this hotel.Each of this rooms is beautifully designed with such a great taste!!! The colors are so cheering! The curtains are the joy to your eyes.The beds are very comfortable. Everything is so clean. The moment you enter the room you feel like you left the worries of the world behind you. Even such little things as several bottles of water in the refrigerator makes you feel that somebody was thinking about your conveniences. You can make your own tea or coffee, the supplies are there in the room. The windows are very clean. The ceilings are high and beautiful. There is a huge mirror in the classic room. The bathrooms are designed very thoughtfully for the needs of everybody. There is a magnifying mirror for the women to apply their make-up. The towels are so soft and are kept warm.The staff is super friendly and they speak English.If you choose to eat breakfast there you are not going to make a mistake. There is no room here to describe how delicius everything is: cheeses, bread, meats, juices, coffees, jams; it's cute how you can make your own eggs; and the setting..Wow!..and the polite staff..Wow! There is a little garden outside, very cosy one. The furniture in the lobby and the adjusting areas is very beautiful, in French style.You can have an umbrella if you did not bring one with you. There are fresh newspapers every morning. Internet connection there is and so on so forth... Thank you to all the people working there ( including Sofia, Emanuella, Bijan and the others) for your wonderful service! These people give you all practical advises necessary when you are traveling the first time in the foreign country. Taxi, wake-up calls, etc.,you can rely on the staff. They are not only knowledgeable, but also very smiling and polite.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel large rooms but a bit of a walk from the tube”
Reviews.Author: GodisGoood
Reviews.Content: great hotel. pastry shop across the street. places to eat near by. but if i were with a family its a bit of a walk from the metro. i would not stay here again due to the location. but the beds, staff, wifi was great. if u do book go directly to the bestwesternwebsite. we paid much less using them directly

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful personal service”
Reviews.Author: bizie2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here five days and loved it. The hotel is newly refurbished...(we stayed here 10 years ago) and very chic. The staff was the best part. They were wonderful (Etienne and Sabine especially) helping with dinner reservations by email prior to our arrival but available for our every need. The rooms were spotless and very comfortable with comfortors and minibars in the rooms. (good place to cool your own drinks) Internet wireless was available and a computer for guest use in lobby. The breakfast is very grand!! (cereals/sausages (cooked/cold sliced), eggs scrambled/boiled, cheeses, breads: croissants, rolls, fruit cut and whole) but expensive so we just walked across the street to a wonderful bakery that opens at 6am. Most bakeries even have cute individual size pizza now for the guys. I had the pain au chocolate everyday. Beware- most French bakeries are closed on Mondays. There is a grocery for other needs on the corner and the hotel is close to Terns Metro, Arc Triumph Metro as well as the Convention center. Thus it was easy walking distance for a meetings. The rooms on the garden side are the best as street noise can be a problem some nights (Thurs has live jazz in bar next door). Our favorite restaurant was very very reasonable great food and only a block away: La Casa de Sergio. Busy nightly so arrive early before 8:15pm. We would stay here again. Great Location. If you have a car as we did. Arrive by 10-11 am when others are checking out. Parking is tight, with 6 inches between cars (standard for Paris) and only 8 spaces. Do not bring a minivan...:)

Reviews.Title: “The hotel, and its staff, met with all my hopes and more.”
Reviews.Author: voyager27nov
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated - close to metro stations and some main attractions. The staff are very welcoming and helpful even before arrival. The room we had was perfect and all the little accessories lovely. My sister had a superb 60th birthday - thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location, great room.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingJ81
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor and were still surprised at how fantastic the hotel was. We stayed in a classic room, it was stylish, had everything we required, had windows which opened over the garden and the bathroom was fantastic. We did not eat at the hotel but there is a bakery opposite and a supermarket at the corner. The location was perfect, just a short stroll (around 10 minute, maybe less) to the Arc de Triomphe. We would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: eos4os
Reviews.Content: everything was fine........room was big.....very clean.....big bathroom...the brekfast was little poor and expensive but there was a bakery accross the street

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: DublinCoopers
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. We went for a superior room with garden view. The room was lovely and spacious with a big bathroom. Couldn't fault the room. The hotel is handy to the arc the triomphe and the metro (charles de gaulle etoille). Had a great couple of days. Highly recommend the pattiserie accross the road. I would not go for the breakfast as it is overpriced at 19 euro a head. But have to say that is the only downside.Would definetley stay here again. We flew to Beauvais and the hotel is only a few minutes walk from where the bus drops you off, very handy.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay, can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: cntrystar8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the BW Regent's Garden for 3 nights vacation in January 2009, extended from a business trip. I absolutely love this hotel, I rank it in my top 5 ever. The location is perfect, decor is beautiful, the amenities unbeatable and the price was fine. The staff was so nice and accomodating, like staying in a prestigious B&B. I stayed on the third (top) floor in a Premier room. I paid 189 euro for Thrs night, 169 euro for Friday and Saturday night. The fridge is stocked with juice, water and soda that are complimentary(!), which made it nice each morning to just grab a drink and trek out in Paris. The bathroom was luxurious with marble, bathrobes, towel warmer, etc. They have a computer to use, I sat and uploaded photos each night and Facebooked. Their breakfast (extra charge) looked really good, but I didn't have it because I'm not a sit-down breakfast person. Instead, I went just across from the hotel, the Desgranges Boulanger-Patisserie....absolutely incredible bread, pastries and treats!!! It's just a few minute walk from the Arc D'triomphe, it took me ~15 mins to walk to the Lourve, including window shopping time on the Champs de Illyses. They are also near several BNP banks, which was perfect because Bank of America doesn't charge you for using BNP ATMs, so you can take small cash out worry-free! I absolutely cannot wait to return to Paris and stay at this hotel. Dinner Tips: We ate next door at Clair something for yummy hamburgers; for an early 6pm dinner go to La Eccluse close-by which is very very nice and pretty reasonable on price.

Reviews.Title: “Classy little hotel”
Reviews.Author: DarcyBerkshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my daughter. The hotel was vey clean and the rooms and en suite bathrooms were excellent. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff , who were most polite and very accomodating.The hotel is very near The Arc de Triomphe, so the location is vey good and we felt completely safe there.We did not eat at the hotel because the exchange rate made it very pricey, however there are a number of good boulangeries nearby and an excellent French Restaurant on the same street We would thoroughly recommend this hotel and look forward to returning..

Reviews.Title: “Great Affordable Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LV23
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of the Best Western hotels in Europe. This one in Paris is in the 17er but very close to the Arc and the Champs Elysees. We walked almost everywhere, but you could easily take the metro as well. The hotel is situated in a calmer area than other hotels where I have stayed in Paris, which was nice. You are able to get a different feel for the city being in this location. We also found fabulous shops and restaurants in the area, which are not typically visited by tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RIBASLisbon_Portugal
Reviews.Content: We went there in January of 2009. It´s a Wonderful Hotel, with a very good location ( a few minutes from Charles de Gaulle Étoile), reasonable rates, very nice rooms, plenty of character, a charming hotel. We really enjoyed our stay there. We will return there next time. The staff was outstanding and we even found two portuguese ladies in their staff. They were amazing. Very good Hotel. Pedro Ribeiro and Ana Fernandes from Portugal

Reviews.Title: “Excellant, excellant, excellant”
Reviews.Author: nryan33
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a nice location and reasonable rates. Really enjoyed our stay here. The hotel has plenty of character, nice rooms and garden. But the outstanding element are the staff. Really friendly and helpful. We didn't eat here but there are areas just to sit and have coffee and locally there are plenty of coffee shops and a superb bakery across the road. Its about a 5-8 minute walk to the Arc but plenty of metros to get you around from there.

Reviews.Title: “classy convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: baddiel1
Reviews.Content: This really is a charming hotel. The service and location is excellent. We stayed in january when it was very cold so it was important to have a few nice restaurant in very close proximity. These were mostly frequented with locals rather than tourists which is always a good sign (Try the galvacher which is only a few yards away). The room was nice and had facilities such as a free soft drinks mini bar and bathrobes. The Breakfast room was elegant and the little garden at the back was very charming. will be back on my next visit to Paris i would imagine.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chrisgale
Reviews.Content: Super Hotel recently refurbished to a very high standard. Comfortable with friendly helpful staff. Walking distance to Metro and main shopping streets. Car parking and small garden which is unusual. Would be great to have breakfast in the garden in Summer. Quite and peaceful yet in the middle of Paris. Went for New Year which was great.

Reviews.Title: “AAA Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: AvalonNSW
Reviews.Content: Not my first stay and by no way my last. I arrived at the end of August and left the 26th October. Amazingly friendly staff and yes renovations were going on as they have just gone from 3 star to 4 star. During this time I did a few trips and I left the extra luggage in the hotel with no problem at all and when I arrived back it was waiting for me in the room. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Paris. Rooms great, service awesome and close to most popular sites. A fantastic experience for such a long stay. P.I Sydney, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Best Western Premier Regent's Garden Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaKimster
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Premier Regent's Garden Hotel was wonderful. We spoke very little French, but the staff all spoke English. The hotel was clean, with new bathrooms and a large shower. The staff was also terrific, making reservations for us for dinner, tours and the train. We loved Paris, and we loved the Premier Regent's Garden Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for our first visit in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Sparkles2008
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel because it was very clean, some what close to the metro, the Arc and there was grocery store right across the street which we used often for fresh fruit and breakfast items as the breakfast in the hotel was a bit expensive. The staff was very friendly and helpful, our room was clean and the hotel is tucked away on a quiet street. The walk to the Arc is around 10 minutes which is great during the day but the streets are a bit quiet in the night. All in all it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “What a gorgeous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dreamingparis
Reviews.Content: I was staying in Paris by myself, having never been there before, in between visiting 2 lots of friends in Europe. From the minute I arrived, I knew that I had made the right choice. This hotel is beautiful. There were some very minor renovations still going on, but absolutely nothing that bothered me (like some tape around room numbers while they were painting, which was there one day, gone the next). I never saw any work, or heard anything. I stayed in a standard room, but it was quite large by Paris standards from what I had read on this website. I had a lovely comfortable bed, writing desk, bed side tables, bar fridge and LCD TV. There was a little foyer with a closet in between the bathroom and bedroom. I even had a bath. On request, the hotel provided tea and coffee making which I believe is standard for the bigger rooms. I used my iphone in my room and in the garden with the free wi-fi the hotel provided. There is also a computer with free web access near the lobby. The foyer downstairs was divine, the garden immaculate and I can't rate this hotel high enough. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. What makes this hotel a stand out is the little supermarket, no more than a 20 second walk across the street. It is such a charming place. It's located in the 17th arrondissement, which is quite residential (but Parisian residences are vastly different to Australian so don't be turned off by that). It gave me a real insight into the Parisian culture being in this location. I was a little worried about the hotel being away from all the action when I booked it, but it definitely was not. A lovely short 7 minute walk or so, and you were at the Acr de Triumph, which is at the top of the shopping end of the Champs Elysees. This is a quieter part of Paris, but definitely not away from the action. I will stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat. It made my short 3 day trip to Paris memorable. When I was leaving, a couple of the larger rooms were being cleaned and I had a quick peak. If you have more than a couple of people, or you want to splurge on the bigger room, you will not be disappointed. They were individually decorated and looked spacious and very charming. I can't wait to return to this hotel again. I don't usually write reviews on things, but seeing as I found this hotel after looking at this website, I wanted everyone else to have the benefit of my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkMilkman
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Great location. The hotel staff was fantastic. I will stay here on all my future trips to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, shame about the price increase!”
Reviews.Author: seg7
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a fantastic Mother-Daughter trip to Paris in August and were very impressed by the quality/cost ratio of Regent's Garden Hotel. We got a really nice, recently refurbished twin room for only 99 Euro (booked direct on the hotels website). However, rather large negative: A few weeks later, having been so impressed by the hotel that I was planning a second trip back there to stay with my husband, I was told by the hotel that it had just been upgraded from a 3* to a 4* hotel and that subsequently the price has increased from 99 Euros for a Classic room to 169 Euros! A huge increase which dramatically changes the 'value for money' aspect of the hotel. While I would agree that an increase was warranted based on the refurbishment, it does not warrant a 70 Euro increase and it's a real shame as it puts a nice little hotel in the unaffordable category for a lot of people who would previously have stayed here (a comment I made to the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: janarie
Reviews.Content: A very well located hotel within 5-10 minutes of two metro stations on different lines. Obviously recently refurbished as it was very smart and stylish. We booked a superior room which was reasonably large and had a view onto the front street,. It had a separate bathroom and toilet (unusual). The bathroom fittings were superb and the quality of the linen was very good. The breakfast room was smart and the breakfast (included in our deal) was more than adequate. Staff were very friendly and welcoming. Added bonuses were a superb patisserie opposite the hotel, a nice little cafe/restaurant next door (Cafe Pierre) if you are two lazy to go anywhere else and an excellent restaurant called 'La Galvacher' in the nearby square with wonderful beef, reasonable prices and friendly service. Thoughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: vinivivek
Reviews.Content: During June 2008, I planned to take my Wife and my Son (11 years old) to their first trip abroad to Munich(Germany), Salzburg(Austria) and Paris(France). After doing a great research on trip advisor for good hotels in Paris, I zeroed in for this hotel. For booking I sent an email to the hotel (found on their website) and was amazed to receive their prompt and decent offer. I booked the hotel. I found no difficulty in reaching the hotel from CDG RER station following the map sent to me over email by the hotel staff. On reaching the hotel, we were welcomed by the hotel staff with great charm and we were informed that our room was being vacated by the earlier tourists and would take about 30 minutes, They made us feel comfortable in their restaurant and served us with complimentary tea and snaks. Within 30 minutes, they informed that our room was ready and they escorted us to our third floor room, It was a really nice triple room with garden view. The bathroom was spotless. Everything was perfect. Moreover, free Wi-Fi internet connectivity was also available in the hotel which helped me a lot for doing the online check-in in flight, accessing emails etc. Every morning free tea was served in rooms. The staff at the reception was exceptionally cooperative and helped us a lot in touring different parts of Paris. My son had very good interactions with the front desk staff. Me and my wife loved the hotel location as all the important attractions like Arc the Triomph, Eiffel Tower, Champ Elysee were at walking distance. Good bus connectivity was available for places like Louvre, Opera House, Sacred Core etc. A good departmental store is just in front of the hotel where you can get all the daily needs items, We enjoyed every bit of our stay at this hotel and would strongly recommend it to any body who wishes to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great value for paris”
Reviews.Author: bombayandy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a fantastic place to stay in Paris, a 5-10 min walk to arc triomphe and about the same to the nearest metro Ternes. Hotel is under renovation summer 2008 but is nearing the end, the foyer was a mess but the front desk staff were happily working around it and looking after us. For the price about 110 euro it was outstanding value because it is a hotel with all the services in a good district and manages to merge the historical paris decor with the modern requirements. As far as european hotel standards go is a good 4 star. Wifi was included, tea and coffee facilities, friendly staff. As mentioned by others champion supermarket across the road along with patisserie. There is also a market which opens up in the streets on the way to ternes metro in the streets just behind, great fresh bread and fruits, etc. Note we stayed during tour de france and it was perfect for champs, close enough, not too close. I will stay again some day soon.

Reviews.Title: “the nicest place to stay in paris!!! loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller61_8
Reviews.Content: after been in paris more than 10 times this hotel is by far the nicest place i ever stayed in paris. its a 39 rooms hotel in a very quiet street and its only 5 minutes walking distance from the arc de triomphe. the rooms are completely renovated, every room has its own charme but they are great. we had room 101 and 112 and there was just a big WOW when we walked into these rooms. the money+price value is fantastic. the little garden (great for having breakfast) makes up the day and the staff is more than friendly. many thanks to sabine who did a great job! whenever i will go back to paris this is the place, and the ONLY place where to stay. No doubt about it and not even a single small something to complain. Simply GREAT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brillant find in Paris-loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Hols3
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th trip to Paris and we had always stayed on the Left Bank on previous trips. We thought we would like a change of scene and also the hotel in which we previously stayed had very small double rooms and our girls are now an age at which its nice to give them there privacy and the family room days are now gone! We booked our trip through a web site and got a rate which included breakfast. When checking in at the desk I enquired if the rooms (2 superior) were overlooking the garden as we had requested. We knew there was no guarantee on this but as soon as we mentioned we would prefer it the very helpful receptionist had it sorted out for us. One had already been a garden view and she changed ours no problem! On arrival into our rooms the four of us were delighted with the cleaniness,size of rooms-especially ours, as it was the same size as the quadruple we had in our previous hotel. It was really a special touch to have tea and coffee making facilities as Paris hotels dont usually have this little touch. The supermarket-Campion chain was very handy just across the road with a huge selection. We were concerned about the area being quieter but it was great to come back to after racing around Paris all day. It was very easy to find as we used the Air France bus from CDG which dropped us off a 5 minute walk away. We used the Ternes metro stop 5-10 minute walk to get around Paris. All in all we can highly recommend this great hotel, they were just one day away from completion of the renovation work and we will no doubt return to stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, currently under renovation”
Reviews.Author: ottwatrvlr
Reviews.Content: This is a nice and cozy hotel located in the 17ie arrondissement. It is walking distance to Arc de Triomphe/Champs Elysee (10 minutes) and the Eiffel Tower (20 minutes) and also close to the Metro and walking distance from drop-off points for (Porte Maillot and Etoile) when using Cars AirFrance from CDG. We were a bit turned off upon our arrival due to the renovations in the common areas of the hotel. Those fears were put to rest when we got into our room which was a nice, recently refurbished "superior" room. Rooms in Paris are notoriously small. I would say that the room that we had was just the right size for 2 people. Bathroom was modern, albeit very narrow between the shower and toilet area. The staff was very friendly and offered good tips/advice on sites nearby. The hotel is in front os a small supermarket, a bakery and a butchery so it is also convenient to grab some food for a quick snack or breakfast. We were there four nights and picked up pastries at the "boulangerie" and juice/yogourt at the supermarket on all but one morning (you don't get much for the 17EUR that they are charging for breakfast at the hotel) I was very satisfied with my stay and would have probably rated the hotel as excellent if it would not currently be under renovation. Speaking of renovations, they were done during "business hours" and did not prove to be a disruption.

Reviews.Title: “don't be put off by the refurb”
Reviews.Author: JulianTunbridgeWells
Reviews.Content: The appearance of this hotel is down at heel (definitely not as good as the official photo). But don't be put off! Once inside, we found that it is being refurbished and we were to occupy a room that had already been refurbished on the first floor. The room was good, with nice bathroom fittings and decor. Cleaning was first-rate. We were told that the hotel is aiming for 4 stars. I think they may be almost there. They need more luxurious towels to complete the effort. The choice of satellite TV stations is however excellent. The reception was still awaiting the refurbishment treatment (and distinctly hang-dog) but the staff are nice and friendly and to be honest you are not likely to spend a lot of time there. Breakfast was also good and there is a charming rear courtyard where you can sit to read the free newspapers. The situation is just great, within walking distance of Place des Ternes Metro and in a quiet back street. There is a really first rate and reasonable restaurant just 200m. up the street called Maison de Campagne - be sure to book ([--])

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous rooms”
Reviews.Author: CountingSchooler
Reviews.Content: Paris has close to a hundred Best Westerns, but the "Premier" hotels are essentially the "first class" brand of their hotels, the Regent's Garden didn't disappoint. Each room has its own unique decor - I was traveling on business so I saw my colleague's room. Each had its own charms - but the beds were exrtemely comfortable, the washrooms clean and fancy thanks to the modern fixtures, and the general decor was just wonderful. I have pictures of my self grinning goofily as I wandered around the room, amazed at how stunning everything looked. The Napoleonic apartments are incredibly spacious, and even the regular rooms are relatively large by Parisian standards. You definitely have room to sprawl here. In addition to having great rooms, the front desk was very helpful too: they shared information on the best options for getting to the airport and when I forgot to return a Parisian friend's electronics they held on to it for her to pick up. They were also prompt in hand-delivering the wireless internet access code to my room on a slip of paper - very good service. Didn't try breakfast as I prefer to go to the shops/cafes like everyone else who knows Paris. Top tip: make sure to try the pastry/bakery shop across the street - it won an award for best chocolate eclair in Paris less than three years ago, and the quality is top notch there too.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: LimerickCailin
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Paris and stayed at the Regents Garden for 4 nights with my boyfriend. We got an excellent deal on the Best Western website and were very impressed with the hotel. The location is ideal, 5 minutes walk to the Arc de Triompe and metro station. The area feels very safe and there are a very good selection of restaurants nearby (recommend the Brassier around the corner where you can cook your own meat). Our deal did not include breakfast at the hotel (which is quite pricey), instead we ate breakfast at the cafe's which were much more reasonable. The hotel is going through some refurbishment at the moment but this did not disturb us in any way, our room was very nicely decorated, really liked the layout and presentation, very clean and modern. The staff were very friendly and good to recommend places to eat, etc. Overall we were very happy with our stay and would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Rugby weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: sean_e78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently with my fiance and found the experience fantastic. The room was recently refurbished, and the service was exceptional. The front desk staff were very friendly, although the guy who served breakfast was on the grumpy side. Overall, we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, recommended to All!”
Reviews.Author: murveyrock28
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Best Western Premier Regent's Garden Hotel from 24 to 27 December. I booked via Best Western website and got an excellent rate. We had a superior non-smoking room. The room was very spacious and clean with a good size, modern bathroom. The view from the room was great, not only we enjoyed the look at the garden but the rooftops of other parisian houses were very pretty indeed. We had our 2 year old son with us and the travel cot in the room was handy. The best thing about this hotel is its location! It is about 10, 15 minutes walk from Arch de Triomphe and 25, 30 minutes from the Eiffel Tower. Also there is a bakery across the road from the hotel with fresh croissants and a supermarket few steps away. Recommended! Oh I almost forgot to add that there is a small lift in the hotel which is helpful when carrying a pram etc. Au revior

Reviews.Title: “New Years in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: sapphiredragon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel days leading up to New Years 2008. You are actually walking distance to the Arc de Triomphe as the hotel is located on that side of town. Definitely a fantastic hotel location if you don't mind walking a little. The hotel has some historical significance as it used to be a mansion of Napoleon III. So it definitely has a charming look and feel about it. The room we stayed however, was remodeled and had a fairly modern french look about it. Very comfortable room and bed. Free in-room wireless internet and public computer in lobby a big plus. The bathroom was decent size and and had a towel warmer. No complaints there. We stayed in room 309 which seemed to be located near or over the next door restaurant/bar which stays open into late into the morning. You can hear chairs being pushed in and out and maybe shoes with heels walk across the wooden floors of the restaurant. May bother you if you are a light sleeper. We walked so much during our stay that at night, we usually slept right through it. The neighborhood in which this hotel is located is great. There is a market and pâtisserie right across the street. Both very nice and convenient. Tons of cafes and shops in the nearby area. The hotel staff was very helpful and spoke good english. Made for a delightful experience. Definitely would stay there again and recommend if you don't mind walking a little.

Reviews.Title: “Absoulutely charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tillieboo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this charming hotel twice this year, in September and November. I located it on the internet and was worried about finding the right place and location as I was traveling alone the first trip. I was thrilled to find a hotel right in the middle of everything, but on a lovely side street with a garden courtyard. I had only planned to stay a few days but because of the staff, location, comfort and feeling of the hotel, I stayed for ten days and then came back in November! The accommodations were excellent. On my first trip, I ended up staying in four different rooms as they accommodated my extra days and they were all lovely. The bathrooms are exceptional( I am very picky!) and the beds are very comfortable. The staff is seasoned and very personal. The little dining room for breakfast is adorable. You really feel like you're in Paris, but also right at home! I hope to return in May.

Reviews.Title: “During the Metro/Train Strike - yaikkkkssss”
Reviews.Author: dwild2005
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our 1 week stay in Paris. We stayed at Best Western Premier Regent's Garden the whole week. The Hotel is old, but well maintained. They have a secured small parking spaces in front of the hotel. The reception stuff speaks english and are very friendly and helpful. The room we were in was small - which is a standard size for Paris. The room and bathroom are clean. Our room faces the street and across the street is a contstruction and it get really loud and noisy with all the drilling and hammering. At night time, we could here the cars on the street, the honking and motorcyle -- a bit loud. Breakfast is not included with the room fee, so you have to pay an extra 12-15 Euros per person, so we decided to walk a few meters up the mainstreet and viola . . . . we found several Boulangerie/Patisserie with excellent bread/pastries/croissants and they also offer petite dejouner. The Hotel is average, nothing spectacular . . . we were out most of the time so we only use the hotel for sleeping. There is a Grocery across the street which is very convinient to buy some drinks and snacks. There is also Boulangerie/Patisserie and Asian food take out. The location of the hotel is pretty convinient . . . the metro (if it was operating normally) is only 10 minutes walk. Etoile and Champs Ellesey are also only 10 minutes walk. We will probably stay at this Hotel again . . . mainly because of the location. The Train/Metro strike started the second day we arrived in Paris -- this was a disaster. We have been in Paris 7 times the past 8 years and we never had this strike experience before. Metro is very important to get around Paris. Ohhh .... what a catastrophe. But we decided to enjoy Paris with or without Metro and we had a great time despite of it all. The worst part was that, we purchased the 5 day Visite Paris -- unlimited Metro ride for 5 days for € 27.00 per piece and we did not even use it. The Metro clerk did not even informed us of the strike when we bought the tickets -- oh, well ce'st la vie! We should have been more informed . . . our bad !

Reviews.Title: “Great wedding anniversary experience”
Reviews.Author: peace08
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Regent's Garden nine nights. Compared to our only other Paris hotel experience 35 years ago, this hotel provided much more luxurious surroundings and a very courteous, attentive staff. We had a quiet room that overlooked the rear garden. The carpeting, tile WC and separate tile shower/bath appeared to have been upgraded recently. The Arc de Triomphe is only about 1/2 mile away, but it is uphill all the way! I recommend using the Ternes metro station if you want to go the the Arc de Triomphe (Charles DeGaulle Etoille Metro) or Museums beyond. On your short walk to or from Ternes Metro, you will walk by one of the best outdoor markets in Paris, where you can pick up fresh bread, cheese, pastry, smoked fish, vegetables, fruit and inexpensive wine for your evening meat in your hotel room. We can recommend the L'Orenoc, Spoon, and Chez Georges restaurants from personal experience. These restaurants are within walking distance of the hotel or Charles DeGaulle Etoille Metro stop. My only disappointment was that the free hotel WiFi Internet connection blocked two of my U.S. email providers, Verizon and Compuserve. Fortunately I had a third email site available that was not blocked. Also, my favorite web browser, Mozilla Firefox, did not work there. The hotel staff could not tell me if the blocking was being done locally or nationally.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Albertasaurus
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights at the BW Regent's Garden in September, 2007. We highly recommend the hotel. We stayed in a Queen-Garden View Room on top floor (3rd floor). The room was spacious by European standards. The bed was large....more like a King size....reasonably comfortable. Washroom was also fairly large with combination tub/shower. The room was very clean. A/C worked well and was quiet. Room comes with bar fridge and safe. Apart from the size of the room, the best thing about the hotel room was how quiet it was. In 6 nights we hardly heard a sound. Staff was courteous. Free computer/internet in the lobby (The hotel guide in the room advised that there was a charge for the lobby internet. However, we used it on several occassions and were not charged.) Two small nits: No kettle tea/coffee in room....although you could ask for a tea/coffee tray free-of-charge at the front desk. Elevator is small. But that's standard for most hotels in Europe. The hotel is located in the 17th Arr.; a 10 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe. Three Metro stations are within a 10 minute walk: Porte Maillot; Charles de Gaulle Etoile (aka Arc de Triomphe) and Ternes. The first two stations also have access to the RER. So while there are few sights close by the hotel....you have easy access to transit. We took the Air France Bus from CDG to Charles de Gaulle Etoile....20 Euros return....took about 45 minutes....with a 10 minute walk from there to the hotel. We didn't try the breakfast in the hotel. There is a great pattiserie across the road and numerous other restaurants, cafes in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great - again!”
Reviews.Author: sfisherphd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Regents Garden last in 1988, before Best Western purchased it. When my teenage son and I decided to take a short hop, Expedia had it listed as one of the top picks. I was a bit wary of what might have changed since BW purchased it - my concerns were completely unfounded. The rooms are spacious by European (particularly Parisian) standards, staff was friendly, and the location is fantastic. The bathroom was clearly recently upgraded, and is again quite large for a boutique hotel in Paris. I agree with all of the previous reviewers and suggest skipping the overpriced breakfast and walking 100 meters to a cafe for le petit dejeuner at half the price. I will be traveling to Paris again in a few months and will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice in this price range”
Reviews.Author: natffm
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to Paris dozens of times and know quite a few hotels there. This was the first time I stayed at the Regent's Garden, and I will make it my favourite from now on. I had booked a Queen's Room with garden view for a little more than 100 EUR. I am not sure if I actually got an upgrade, because the room I got (on the top floor) was the spaciest I have ever seen in this city, where the standard is to be crammed into some tiny space where little else than the bed fits in. The view to the garden was not really overwhelming, but pleasant. Totally quite, except some occasional noise from what I guess was the elevator. I could easily cope with that. The decor was nice, what you might call typically Parisian, as in the rest of the hotel. The garden is a great feature, very rare in Paris. Staff was friendly and efficient, and really everybody speaks English - they not only know it, they actually speak it, which is also not typical for France. Highspeed internet for free in the lobby. I am not sure about internet in the rooms since I did not bring my notebook. The only real downside was the breakfast buffet, which at 14 EUR is wildly overpriced. Choice is rather limited, and they even charge you extra for scrambled eggs and the like. When I came in short before closing on the last morning, there was hardly anything left, but I still paid the 14 EUR. While it is certainly very nice to have your breakfast in the garden, you will get much better value outside. What I liked, however, was the "fair trade" tea and coffee which I have very seldom seen at any hotel. The location is OK but not exciting, in a mid- to upscale residential neighbourhood with little of interest. It is about 10-15 min walk to the Arc de Triomphe. If you want to stay close to the main tourist attractions, this is probably not the optimal choice, but anyway the metro system is so efficient it does not really matter where you are located. There are several stations on various lines within 10 min walking range.
